concept.title: New specialization attributes and elements
concept.shortdesc: LwDITA introduces new attributes and elements for simplified content type specialization. These attributes and elements only exist in the XDITA authoring format. Mention that specialization will be addressed in a future publication?

section.title: Attributes for defining structural specializations
section.p: The following attributes are specialized from base; they are available on all XDITA elements.

draft-comment.author: Kristen J Eberlein
draft-comment.p: We need to be careful in wording here. The TC is NOT going to do two releases of Lightweight DITA.
If the design for Lightweight DITA includes new mechanisms for template-based specialization, the design work for that component needs to be nailed down quickly.

dlentry.dd: Provides the name for the specialized element
Enables the author to define a sequence, define a choice group, or decide that the content model should be the same of the original element
Specifies whether the element is required or optional

section.title: Elements for specializations of ph, data and props
section.p: The following elements are available for use in prolog:

dlentry.dd: Describes any number of data, ph, or specatt elements. data and ph must be annotated with specname to define the name of the specialized elements. specmeta is a child of prolog.
Defines specializations of props, using the value of specname to define the name of the specialized attribute

section.title: Attribute for single-sourcing

dlentry.dd: Specifies whether the content of an element is intended to be generated by the transform, editable by the author, an editor prompt, documentation, or used for content modeling purposes only (or any mix of the above); if unset, element content is editable by author (part of the template)

section.draft-comment: This needs more work. What values will this attribute take?

draft-comment.author: Kristen J Eberlein
draft-comment.p: Carlo's paste of content from the GitHub repo included the following in its discussion of importance: "defaults to required in a sequence; optional in a choice group." How?

draft-comment.author: Kristen J Eberlein
draft-comment.p: What will specatt and specmeta be specialized from? Has this work been done?
And how do you plan handle domain specializations? How will they be used across topics?
